title: Floating roses + hearts concurrent background with tunable density

requirements.summary: Ensure roses and hearts are always present concurrently in the subtle, non-interactive background layer behind hero content.
acceptanceCriteria: On load, the background includes visible heart particles and visible rose particles at the same time.
The animation remains layered behind the page content (hero text, buttons, overlays) and does not obscure readability.
The animation remains non-interactive (does not block clicking or scrolling).

file_operations.description: Change particle initialization to deterministically create both heart and rose particles concurrently (based on a fixed per-type count rather than per-particle random type) and keep rendering subtle. Preserve full-screen fixed canvas layering behind content and keep pointer-events disabled; add robust animation cleanup if needed.

requirements.summary: Add simple tuning controls for particle count and per-type distribution; moderately increase density while keeping a single smooth full-screen canvas.
acceptanceCriteria: Particle density is increased compared to the current implementation (currently `particleCount = 20`).
Hearts and roses are generated in a controlled distribution (e.g., roughly 50/50 or configurable), not purely random selection that could result in near-zero of one type.
Animation remains smooth on typical screen sizes without obvious frame drops, and still uses a single fixed full-screen canvas.

file_operations.description: Introduce a small settings API (e.g., props and/or exported defaults) for tuning total particle count and heart/rose split, and apply these settings to particle generation. Increase default density moderately above 20 while maintaining performance (e.g., cap counts, use devicePixelRatio-aware sizing, avoid per-frame allocations, and ensure a single fixed full-screen canvas).

Pass the desired background particle tuning values into FloatingHeartsRosesBackground (or reference exported defaults) to apply the increased density and controlled heart/rose distribution without adding new pages/routes or changing hero/overlay/footer text.
